Description: Joseph distributing grain in Egypt. Joseph stands on a platform of a palatial building and a servant holds a parasol over his head, he looks aghast at the scene beneath him, below figures pay to receive grain, a woman kneels and offers her necklace besides an old woman and with a crying baby before her, a number of officials sit around a stone desk at left to receive the payment and a scribe writes in his account book, a man lifts with both hands a heavy basket and another ties the neck of a sack with a rope, a man with a turban rides a camel at right surrounded by sheep and cattle, beyond are more buildings and a tall column with a statue; the third and final state with Schenk's address Etching
Producer name: Print made by: Jan de Bisschop
Curator's comments: This is a copy after the engraving by Bartholomeus Breenbergh, for comment see S.6039.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (1.III)
Acquisition notes: For the history of the acquisition of the Sheepshanks collection, please see Sheepshanks.1
